Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • Piece
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
    public abstract class Piece
extends java.lang.Object
    The Piece class is a generic abstract class that serves as the model for the more specific Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, and Rook classes. It contains methods that aid in general piece movement, and the model for the abstract method isValidMove.
    Author:
    Jared Entin, Antonio Diaz

    • Method Detail

      • pieceAt

        public Piece pieceAt​(int r,
                     int c,
                     java.util.ArrayList<Piece> pieces)
        Gets Piece instance at specified row and column
        Parameters:
        r - row
        c - column
        pieces - An arraylist of pieces currently on the board
        Returns:
        Null if no piece at given location. Otherwise, returns piece at location.

      • inBounds

        public boolean inBounds​(int targetRow,
                        int targetCol)
        Determines whether specified coordinates are in bounds
        Parameters:
        targetRow - Row of target move location
        targetCol - Column of target move location
        Returns:
        Whether or not the target location is within the bounds of the board

      • checkPath

        public boolean checkPath​(java.util.ArrayList<Piece> pieces,
                         int tR,
                         int tC)
        Checks for obstruction between current Piece and target destination. Works for diagonal, horizontal, and vertical paths
        Parameters:
        pieces - An arraylist of pieces currently on the board
        tR - Row of target move location
        tC - Column of target move location
        Returns:
        Whether or not the piece's path is obstructed

      • isMyTurn

        public boolean isMyTurn​(int turn)
        Is this piece's team allowed to move
        Parameters:
        turn - Current turn number
        Returns:
        Whether or not it is the piece's team's turn

      • sameSpace

        public boolean sameSpace​(int r,
                         int c)
        Determines if target destination is actually the current destination
        Parameters:
        r - Row of target location
        c - Column of target location
        Returns:
        Whether the target space is the piece's current space or not

      • sameTeam

        public boolean sameTeam​(Piece p)
        Compares team of 2 different pieces
        Parameters:
        p - Piece to compare teams
        Returns:
        True if same team. False if not.

      • moveIsVertical

        public boolean moveIsVertical​(int c)
        Is the target vertically oriented
        Parameters:
        c - Target column
        Returns:
        True if the target column is the same as the current column. False if not.

      • moveIsHorizontal

        public boolean moveIsHorizontal​(int r)
        Is the target horizontally oriented
        Parameters:
        r - Target row
        Returns:
        True if the target row is the same as the current row. False if not.

      • moveIsDiagonal

        public boolean moveIsDiagonal​(int r,
                              int c)
        Is the target diagonally oriented
        Parameters:
        r - Target row
        c - Target column
        Returns:
        True if the target move is diagonal. False if not.

      • isValidMove

        public boolean isValidMove​(java.lang.String[][] board,
                           java.util.ArrayList<Piece> pieces,
                           int targetRow,
                           int targetCol,
                           int turn,
                           King myKing)
        Determines if this piece can move to its target space
        Parameters:
        board - The 2-D array with pieces on it
        pieces - An ArrayList of pieces currently on the board
        targetRow - Target row
        targetCol - Target column
        turn - Turn number
        myKing - The turn player's king piece
        Returns:
        Whether the attempted move is legal or not
